definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: In comparison with the Americans, Chinese are more sensitive about their face.
sentences.chinese: 和美國人相比，中國人非常重視他們的臉面。

sentences.english: With the waiting depot, the arriving coffin, and the somber faces.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是停柩所，是已運到的棺木，和無數陰沉的臉面。

sentences.english: He stayed in the hospital for half a year and returned home with a ruined face and a crippled leg.
sentences.chinese: 他在醫院裏呆了半年，回家時，臉面已毀，腿也跛了。

sentences.english: In spite of his face, which also allow for the kids, with him.
sentences.chinese: 不顧自己的臉面，也該顧及一下孩子們吧，隨他去。

sentences.english: He dropped the gold down the chimney to save face for the impoverished father.
sentences.chinese: 他將黃金扔進煙囪以保留這位窮困的父親的臉面。

sentences.english: Tears brim over with tears, tears falling on my face.
sentences.chinese: 淚水奪眶而出，長淚落在了我的臉面。

sentences.english: And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground, and I became dumb.
sentences.chinese: 他向我這樣說，我就臉面朝地，啞口無聲。

sentences.english: Person if be forced matchless place, the square knows that the face didn't exist magnitude.
sentences.chinese: 人若是被逼到絕處，方知臉面並沒有生存重要。

sentences.english: HIV Death life, but also did not face his family.
sentences.chinese: 染上艾滋命歸天，還要家人沒臉面。

sentences.english: His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.
sentences.chinese: 臉面明亮如日頭，衣裳潔白如光。

definition: to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
